intro: Notothixos subaureus var. cinereus, commonly known as the gray-leafed sunflower, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which helps reflect sunlight and reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. The plant produces daisy-like yellow flowers with prominent brown centers, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it well adapted to semi-arid and desert climates.
